ayas.translation: NUN. I CALL to witness the pen and what they inscribe,
ayas.transliteration: nūn ۚ wal qalami wa mā yasṭurūn

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, most benevolent, ever-merciful.

ayas.translation: You are not demented by the grace of your Lord.
There is surely reward unending for you,
ayas.transliteration: wa inna laka la-ajran ghayra mamnūn

ayas.translation: For you are verily born of sublime nature.
So you will see, and they will realise,
Who is distracted.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
ayas.translation: Verily your Lord knows those who have gone astray from His path, and He knows those who are guided on the way.
ayas.transliteration: inna rabbaka huwa a`lamu biman ḍalla `an sabīlihi wahuwa a`lamu bil muhtadīn

ayas.translation: So do not comply with those who deny:
They only want that you should relent, so that they may come to terms.
Do not heed a contemptible swearer,
Or backbiter, calumniator, slanderer,
Who hinders men from (doing) good, the transgressor, the iniquitous,
Crude, and above all, mean and infamous,
Simply because he possesses wealth and children.

ayas.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayas.translation: When you recite Our revelations to him, he says: "These are fables of long ago."
We shall brand him on the muzzle.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
ayas.translation: We have tried you as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed to gather the fruits in the morning
ayas.transliteration: innā balawnāhum kamā balawnā aṣ-ḥābal jannati idh aqsamū layaṣrimunnahā muṣbiḥīn

ayas.translation: But did not add: "If God may please."

ayas.arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
ayas.translation: Then a calamity from your Lord fell upon it, but they remained fast asleep.
ayas.transliteration: faṭāfa `alayhā ṭā-ifun min rabbika wahum nā-imūn

ayas.translation: So by the morning it seemed as though picked clean.
At daybreak they called to each other:

ayas.arabic: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
ayas.translation: "If you want to gather the fruits, let us go early to the plantation."
So they departed, talking in low voices:

ayas.arabic: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
ayas.translation: "Let no needy person come to you within it today."
They left early in the morning bent on this purpose.
When they saw (and did not recognise it) they said: "Surely we have lost the way.
No. In fact we have been deprived of it."

ayas.arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
ayas.translation: One who was temperate among them, said: "Did I not say: 'Why don't you priase God?'"
ayas.transliteration: qāla awsaṭuhum alam aqul lakum lawlā tusabbiḥūn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: "Glory to our Lord," they said; we were really in the wrong."
ayas.transliteration: qālū subḥāna rabbinā innā kunnā ẓālimīn

ayas.translation: Then they started blaming one another,
Saying: "Alas the woe, we were iniquitous.

ayas.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
ayas.translation: Maybe our Lord will give us better than this. We turn to our Lord in supplication."
ayas.transliteration: `asā rabbunā an yubdilanā khayran minhā innā ilā rabbinā rāghibūn

ayas.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: Such is Our chastisement; and the punishment of the Hereafter will be greater, if only they knew!
ayas.transliteration: kadhālikal `adhāb ۖ wala`adhābul-ākhirati akbar ۚ law kānū ya`lamūn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
ayas.translation: For those who fear God there are pleasure gardens with their Lord.
Should We treat those who submit and obey in the same way as those who are culpable?
What has come upon you that you judge in such a wise?
Or have you a Book in which you read
That you can surely have whatever you choose?

ayas.arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
ayas.translation: Or have you taken a binding promise from Us which would hold till the Day of Judgement, that you will get whatever you demand?
ayas.transliteration: am lakum aymānun `alaynā bālighatun ilā yawmil qiyāmati inna lakum lamā taḥkumūn

ayas.translation: Ask them: "Which of you is able to vouch for this?"

ayas.arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
ayas.translation: Or have they any partners? Let them bring their partners then, if what they say is true.
ayas.transliteration: am lahum shurakā-u falya-tū bishurakā-ihim in kānū ṣādiqīn

ayas.arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
ayas.translation: On the day the great calamity befalls, and they are called to bow in homage, they will not be able to do so.
ayas.transliteration: yawma yukshafu `an sāqin wayud`awna ilas sujūdi falā yastaṭī`ūn

ayas.arabic: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: Lowered will be their eyes, disgrace overwhelming them. They had indeed been called to bow in homage when they were free of blame.
ayas.transliteration: khāshi`atan abṣāruhum tarhaquhum dhillah ۖ waqad kānū yud`awna ilas sujūdi wahum sālimūn

ayas.arabic: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: So leave those who deny this Discourse to Me. We shall lead them step by step to (ruin) in a way they will not know.
ayas.transliteration: fadharnī wa man yukadhhibu bihādhal ḥadīth ۖ sanastadrijuhum min ḥaythu lā ya`lamūn

ayas.translation: Yet I will give them respite: Surely My plan is compact.

ayas.arabic: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
ayas.translation: Do you ask for any compensation from them that they are burdened with want?
ayas.transliteration: am tas-aluhum ajran fahum min maghramin muthqalūn

ayas.translation: Or do they have knowledge of the unknown which they copy down?

ayas.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
ayas.translation: So wait with patience for the judgement of your Lord, and do not be like (onah) of the fish who called (to his Lord) when he was choked with anger.
ayas.transliteration: faṣbir liḥukmi rabbika walā takun kaṣāḥibil ḥūti idh nādā wahuwa makẓūm

ayas.arabic: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
ayas.translation: Had it not been for a favour from his Lord he would have been cast blame-worthy on a barren plain.
ayas.transliteration: lawlā an tadārakahu ni`matun min rabbihi lanubidha bil `arā-i wahuwa madhmūm

ayas.translation: Then his Lord chose him and placed him among the upright.

ayas.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
ayas.translation: But the unbelievers would like to stare you out of balance when they hear the warning, and say: "Surely he is possessed;"
ayas.transliteration: wa in yakādul ladhīna kafarū layuzliqūnaka bi-abṣārihim lammā sami`udh dhikra wayaqūlūna innahu lamajnūn

ayas.translation: Whilst it is no more than reminder for the people of the world.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā huwa illā dhikrul lil`ālamīn
